body_text:
This does two things:

Removes the config that silences all webpack output during test runs, and adds a config that only shows webpack middleware errors (and a few minor status lines from webpack itself).
Changes the regexes used in index.js files in the tests to look for files that start with test_, and renames all the test files to match this. The tests were showing a warning message due to entry points being pulled in by the index.js files (I think it was the index.js files themselves, but I'm not sure). This fixes that by requiring test files to explicitly start with a test_ prefix.

r?

  • Changes the regexes used in index.js files in the tests to look for files that start with test_, and renames all the test files to match this. The tests were showing a warning message due to entry points being pulled in by the index.js files (I think it was the index.js files themselves, but I'm not sure). This fixes that by requiring test files to explicitly start with a test_ prefix.

title: Fix webpack errors during tests
body:
This does two things:
- Removes the config that silences _all_ webpack output during test runs, and adds a config that only shows webpack middleware errors (and a few minor status lines from webpack itself).
- Changes the regexes used in `index.js` files in the tests to look for files that start with `test_`, and renames all the test files to match this. The tests were showing a warning message due to entry points being pulled in by the `index.js` files (I think it was the `index.js` files themselves, but I'm not sure). This fixes that by requiring test files to explicitly start with a `test_` prefix.

r?
